Pre-Apocalypse[]: Almost nothing is known about Wilson's life prior to or as the outbreak began, except that he was a soldier in the National Guard.
Post-Apocalypse[]: Wilson was seen with a group of soldiers being approached by the Governor of Woodbury as he set his M4 Carbine with a grenade launcher ready. The soldier was greeted by the Governor, who informed the convoy that he had recovered Welles . Wilson then witnessed Brady being shot by the Governor. After the corporal's murder, he had no time to react as they were ambushed and killed by the Woodbury soldiers. After the massacre of the Woodbury militia, the Governor, along with Martinez , and Shumpert , returned to the campsite where Wilson and the rest of his squad were slaughtered. The bodies of Wilson, Corporal Brady, and the other soldiers were seen almost fully devoured and ignored as the Governor and his men set up camp for the night.
Death[]: Killed By Lieutenant Welles (Indirectly Caused) Philip Blake (Caused) Woodbury Soldiers After being ambushed by the Woodbury soldiers due to the reveal of their location to the Governor by Lieutenant Welles, Wilson is shot to death.
Killed Victims[]: This list shows the victims Wilson has killed: Possibly numerous unnamed enemy combatants (Pre-Apocalypse) Possibly numerous counts of zombies and unnamed people
Appearances[]: " Walk With Me " (No Lines) " Live Bait " (Flashback, Corpse)
Trivia[]: Wilson was never credited or identified through dialogue, nor did he have any lines. His character's name only exists through his identification tag on his uniform.
